oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Oral history interview with Catherine Berry Pilcher Avery, 1981 February , excerpt 09
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: An excerpt from an oral history interview with Catherine Berry Pilcher Avery, conducted on the 09 February 1981 and the 13 February 1981 by Leanne Thornton as part of the Historic Nashville, Inc. 1910-1935 Oral History Project. Avery, the great-granddaughter of early Nashville bookstore owner William Tyler Berry and member of the Ladies Hermitage Association, discusses the clerks and merchandise at Thompson's store on 5th Avenue during the early 1900s. She also describes how people had to have their clothing made rather than being able to purchase it off the rack. The complete interview is available in the repository.
